level.heading: DISTRICT ROSTER OF HANDGUNS DETERMINED NOT TO BE UNSAFE (§ 24-2323)

level.text: 2323.1 The Metropolitan Police Department shall establish the District Rosterf Handguns Determined Not to be Unsafe (District Roster). Pursuant to §04(e)(4) and 504(f) of the Act (D.C. Official Code § 7-2505.04 (e)(4) &f) (2012 Repl.)), the District Roster shall constitute the roster of pistolshat may be manufactured, sold, given, loaned, exposed for sale, transferred, ormported into the District of Columbia notwithstanding § 504(a) of the Act, andhat may be owned or possessed within the District of Columbia notwithstanding 504(b) of the Act.

Any pistol that is on the California Roster of Handguns Certified for Salealso known as the California Roster of Handguns Determined Not to be Unsafe)California Roster), pursuant to California Penal Code § 12131, as of January, 2009, unless such pistol is an unregisterable firearm pursuant to § 202 ofhe Act (D.C. Official Code § 7-2502.02 (2013 Supp.));
Any pistol that was listed on the California Roster prior to January 1,009, which was, or is subsequently, removed from the California Roster for anyeason not related to the pistol’s safety;

Any pistol listed on the January 1, 2009, Maryland Department of Stateolice Official Handgun Roster, as of January 1, 2009, published as Attachment Ao this section, unless such pistol is an unregisterable firearm pursuant to §02 of the Act (D.C. Official Code § 7-2502.02 (2013 Supp.)); and

Any pistol listed on the Commonwealth of Massachusetts Executive Office ofublic Safety and Security Approved Firearms Roster, as of April 2, 2009,ublished as Attachment B to this section, unless such pistol is annregisterable firearm pursuant to § 202 of the Act (D.C. Official Code §-2502.02 (2013 Supp.)).

2323.3 A pistol shall be deemed to be included on the District Roster ifnother pistol made by the same manufacturer is already listed and the unlistedistol differs from the listed firearm only in one (1) or more of the followingeatures:
Finish, including, but not limited to, bluing, chrome-plating, oiling, orngraving.
The material from which the grips are made.

The shape or texture of the grips, so long as the difference in grip shaper texture does not in any way alter the dimensions, material, linkage, orunctioning of the magazine well, the barrel, the chamber, or any of theomponents of the firing mechanism of the pistol.

Any other purely cosmetic feature that does not in any way alter theimensions, material, linkage, or functioning of the magazine well, the barrel,he chamber, or any of the components of the firing mechanism of the pistol.
2323.4 Any applicant seeking to have a pistol registered under § 2323.3 shallrovide to the Chief all of the following:
The model designation of the listed firearm.
The model designation of each firearm that the applicant seeks to haveegistered under this section.

A statement, under oath, that each unlisted pistol for which registrations sought differs from the listed pistol only in one (1) or more of the waysdentified in § 2323.3 and is in all other respects identical to the listedistol.

2323.5 Any decision refusing registration pursuant to this section may beppealed to the Chief pursuant to § 210 of the Act (D.C. Official Code §-2502.10 (2012 Repl.)), and thereafter to the Office of Administrativeearings, pursuant to D.C. Official Code § 2-1831.03(b-2) (2012 Repl.). In anyuch appeal, the applicant shall bear the burden of demonstrating that thehief’s decision should be reversed and registration permitted.

2323.6 The make and model of any pistol registered pursuant to §§ 2323.3hrough 2323.5 shall be recorded by the Metropolitan Police Department in such aanner to allow the Chief to waive the requirements of § 2323.4 in the event andditional applicant seeks registration for an identical pistol.

Executive Office of Public Safety and Security
This Roster Supersedes All Previous Rosters

Modifications to this roster are likely to occur periodically, and licensees andaw enforcement personnel should always utilize the most recent roster forurposes of determining statutory compliance. The Approved Firearms Rosterosted on the website of the Executive Office of Public Safetywww.mass.gov/EOPS) will contain the most recently approved models.

Massachusetts licensed firearms dealers should note that the transfers ofandguns are also subject to the Attorney General’s Handgun Sales Regulations,40 CMR 16.00, et seq. Firearms on this Approved Firearms Roster do notecessarily comply with the requirements of the Attorney General’s Handgunales Regulations. Information about those regulations, as well as thenforcement Notice may be obtained from the Office of the Attorney General anday be accessed on the website of the Attorney General (www.ago.state.ma.us).”
